upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: He perceived that breath 1 is Brahman, for from breath these beings are born; by breath, when born, they live; into breath they enter at their death.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: Having perceived this, he went again to his father Varu n a, saying: 'Sir, teach me Brahman.' He said to him: 'Try to know Brahman by penance, for penance is (the means of knowing) Brahman.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: He performed penance. Having performed penance--

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive

text: 65:1 Or life; see B ri h. Âr. Up. IV, 1, 3.
